moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 Nc6 3. Nf3 Bf5 4. c3: Necessary or Nb4 would be an annoyance.
moves.4... Qd7: Not common. Normal is Nf6, e6 etc.
moves.5. Nbd2 O-O-O: Royal pieces aligned, and I have a dsb...
moves.6. h3: Let's go for the diagonal. I have a plan, based on...
moves.6... f6 7. g4 Bg6 8. h4: ...based on g4 is "defended" by the threat of Bh3, winning the Q. I can't play g5, though, or f5.
moves.8... e5: ? black is just not strong enough on e4.
moves.11... Qe6 12. Ndf3 Bd6: g5 is not a threat while black can interpose the lsb, so...
moves.14... Nf6 15. Qe6+: ? Qa5 won a tempo by threatening a7.
moves.15... Kb8 16. g5: The g4 pawn is not "defended" bt Bh3 now, so I have to defend it.
moves.16... Rhe8 17. Qb3: Maybe better was Qc4, to prevent Ng4, but Re4 would have done it anyway.
moves.17... Ng4 18. Bh3: Even better, Bg7, threatening Ne5 (and mate in b7).
moves.19. Kxf2 h5 20. Qc4: Made to prevent the Bdsb to reach f4 or c5.
moves.20... b6 21. Rae1 Bc5+: I'm +4, but I'm struggling with the defence.
moves.22. e3 Qc2+ 23. Re2 Bxe3+ 24. Kg2: Not on the black squares, of course.
moves.24... Qg6: Could have black tried something more? It doesn't seem so!
moves.26. Qb5 c6 27. Ne5: Played with resignation to exchange Q's.
moves.29... Kc7 30. Re2xe3: ! If NxR, Qe5+, and Black can find counterplay (more than QxNc6).
moves.30... Rd2+ 31. Kg1: The only think I need is not another check.
moves.32. Re3e7+ Rd7: Here I lost by time, without seeing the winning...
